page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: There are more than a dozen farms that use land in this area. Many are very old and some were accounted in the original Domesday. Between them these farms cover a wide range of mixed farming. Pigs are kept and end up as bacon at the Harris factory in Totnes. This is the home of the South Devon cattle but some farmers have given up the meat side because of the EEC. Milk is produced at 4500l per cow. The milk is collected by tanker. Growing is mostly Barley and Silage but Potatoes and other cereals are also grwon on a lesser scale.. Most farms employ casual or farm and all are well mechanised some even to owning their own Combine. A lot of the farms also make income from cottage and caravan lettings during the summer.
